repnme.cdata!: Papua New Guinea - Special Interventions Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Special Interventions Project in Papua
            New Guinea (PNG). As stated in the Staff Appraisal Report
            (SAR), the objectives of the Bankfinanced Special
            Interventions Project (SIP) were to: (a) address the more
            urgent social needs arising from PNG's ongoing economic
            adjustment by enhancing employment opportunities among low
            income, unemployed and under-employed urban workers; and (b)
            strengthen the institutional capacity of the government to
            better formulate and implement projects. Bank's
            performance was not satisfactory. Borrower's
            performance was not satisfactory. The key lessons learned
            were as follows: (a) when project objectives are clear and
            stakeholder support is widespread, as in the case of the
            drainage component, good implementation performance is an
            entirely reasonable prospect in Papua New Guinea; (b) in the
            preparation of projects, there is a clear need for
            consistency between project objectives and project design as
            evidenced in the failure of the housing component; (c) the
            design of the project should relate the short-term
            objectives to the overall policy framework for the sector
            and any long-term sector reform effort;(d) institutional
            development through provision of consultant advisory
            services may fail to deliver results in the absence of a
            stable operating environment characterized by decisive and
            stable project management dedicated to well defined and
            widely agreed objectives; and (e) project complexity, as
            reflected by a large number of participating agencies, must
            be calibrated carefully in line with the Borrower's
            capacity, otherwise it may impose an undue burden of
            oversight on the Borrower and adversely affect project
            performance as it did in this case.

repnme.cdata!: Papua New Guinea - Special Interventions Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Special
            Interventions Project are include:  (a) enhancing employment
            opportunities among low income and unemployed urban workers
            through labor intensive work programs such as drainage and
            house construction; (b) providing finance for mortgages for
            low and middle income houseowners; (c) assisting small
            contractors and entrepreneurs; and (d) strengthening project
            planning, monitoring and management.  The project components
            include:  (a) provision of housing and plot mortgages
            through a Housing Refinancing Facility (HRF) and commercial
            banks, (b) strengthening of the National Housing
            Corporation; (c) improvement of about 12,000 meters of side
            drainage along selected national roads; (d) carrying out a
            drainage masterplan study and an urban services study; (e)
            providing technical assistance to small industry; and (f)
            strengthening project planning, management and monitoring in
            the Department of Finance and Planning.
